1.  Let $A$ be a $2\times 2$ matrix and let $\lambda_1, \lambda_2$ be eigenvalues of $A$. Show that:

    a.  $\lambda_1 + \lambda_2 =\text{trace}(A)$
    a.  $\lambda_1 \cdot \lambda_2  =\text{det}(A)$
    
1.  Complete the table.

    |Case|type|stability|$(\text{tr}A)^2-4\text{det}A$|$\text{det}(A)$|$\text{trace}A$|
    |:----:|:----:|:----:|:----:|:----:|:----:|
    |$\lambda_1 < \lambda_2 < 0$|sink|stable|+| | |
    |$0 < \lambda_1 < \lambda_2$| | | | | |
    |$\lambda_1 < 0 < \lambda_2$| | | | | |
    |$\alpha\pm i\beta , \alpha = 0$| | | | | |
    |$\alpha\pm i\beta , \alpha < 0$| | | | | |
    |$\alpha\pm i\beta , \alpha\gt 0$| | | | | |
